thread.title: Watch: Premature baby hippo takes its first steps at US zoo
thread.title_full: Watch: Premature baby hippo takes its first steps at US zoo

title: Watch: Premature baby hippo takes its first steps at US zoo
text:
The zoo says Fiona "gets pool exercise 2-3 times per day to help her build strength and get the hang of diving, floating and breathing", and is gradually gaining weight. A video posted by Cincinnati Zoo (@cincinnatizoo) on Feb 7, 2017 at 9:47am PST 
Keepers are looking forward to reunite mum and baby soon. 
Fiona is the first Nile hippo born at the Cincinnati Zoo in 75 years. 
Her mum, 17-year-old Bibi, had a March due date. Ad Feedback 
Her birth on January 24 worried keepers, who were not certain when she could get on her feet. 
"Her little system is underdeveloped, and getting her to a healthy weight will be a challenge," they said then. "Vets and animal staff are doing everything they can to get her through this critical time. 
"She looks like a normal calf but is very, very small. Her heart and lungs sound good and she is pretty responsive to stimuli, but we aren't sure how developed her muscles and brain are." - Stuff
